content.description: Unsure of the route name this was our best guest. Chimney up behind a pillar into an off fingers crack that quickly gets wide through a roof bulge. Climb more wide to a slot where you can clip the chains. Don't be intimidated by the wide or the steep plenty of face footholds ease the grade..
content.protection: Double rack from off fingers to number 5
content.location: From the approach trailhead right until a short 4m pilar with a thin off fingers crack is before you!

content.description: Far right down the cliff in a left facing corner the Gravity Warden awaits! Start in a .5 crack expanding until you hit the off width. Hope the Gravity Warden is on your side and prepared you before you left the ground (number 6 was used). Glory steep hands leads you to the top.
content.protection: single rack to 3 and a number 6 if you are bad at off width
content.location: Right side of cliff. Tablet marks the spot

content.description:
Contrary to popular believe, this route is not chossy like the name suggests. Just as the rope was pulled from the freshly pounded in anchor, a loud boom echoed through the canyons walls. It couldn't be mistaken. The sound of choss rain. No it wasn't the neighboring route The Bowie Knife toppling (yet). It came from further down, choss echos was born.

Climb easy terrain to a stairstepper offwidth then transfer into the perfect #2 crack to finish the route off.
content.location: Head to the shady side of the crag from the approach trail one of the first routes you see on the right.

content.description: When you didn't bring the can opener and there's only one thing that'll do the job... the serrated edge of this crack. Sharpen up your leading skills and climb a wide jagged left facing 90ft layback flake. Be careful with the rope on the lead, the bowie's been known to bite..
content.protection: doubles to triples in 4 & 5 optional 6 at beginning. 4.5 could be nice. 2 bolt 4 3/4 powers w/ rap rings.
content.location: Giant sharp detached pilar a short walk from the cliffs edge when hiking up from river.
